summary: This is an email chain from November 24, 2021, between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding press guidance for the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses the use of pseudonyms for victim and non-victim witnesses to protect identities and provides logistical details for the final pretrial conference.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice minors to travel to engage in criminal sexual activity. Her trial is the subject of the press guidance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the individual with whom Ghislaine Maxwell conspired to commit the alleged crimes.

persons.name: Alison Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge over the final pretrial conference and trial in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jim Margolin
persons.context: A colleague in the U.S. Attorney's Office who can be contacted to establish access to the government exhibit file share.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Epstein to entice minors to travel to engage in criminal sexual activity.

events.title: Press Guidance Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues press guidance regarding the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial, detailing witness anonymity policies and media access.

events.title: Final Pretrial Conference
events.description: A final pretrial conference is scheduled for 9:30 a.m. in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell before Judge Alison Nathan.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The government anticipates witnesses, including non-victims, will testify using pseudonyms to protect the identities of victims.
The Court granted a government motion allowing witnesses to use pseudonyms due to the sensitive and explicit nature of the expected testimony regarding illegal sexual abuse.
The press guidance urges media to abide by policies against identifying sex crime victims without consent.
Government exhibits for the trial are provided exclusively through a secure SDNY file share (USAFx), requiring media to establish access accounts.
The document confirms the ongoing legal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell for conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice minors.
